metadata.Title: CVE-2022-21455 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component: Server: PAM Auth Plugin). Supported versions that are affected are 8.0.28 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows high privileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized creation, deletion or modification access to critical data or all MySQL Server accessible data. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 4.9 (Integrity impacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:H/A:N).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-21455` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient21 - 8.0.29-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
mysql-client - 8.0.29-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
mysql-client-8.0 - 8.0.29-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
mysql-client-core-8.0 - 8.0.29-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
mysql-router - 8.0.29-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
mysql-server - 8.0.29-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
mysql-server-8.0 - 8.0.29-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
mysql-server-core-8.0 - 8.0.29-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
mysql-source-8.0 - 8.0.29-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
mysql-testsuite - 8.0.29-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
mysql-testsuite-8.0 - 8.0.29-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> since 5.5 is no longer upstream supported and so far we cannot patch it, marking it as ignored. mdeslaur> 8.x only

criterions.comment: mariadb-10.3 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mysql-8.0 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.29-0ubuntu0.20.04.2').
